SEARCH
Package com.app.validate

Interface Validator<T>

Type Parameters:
T - the type of object to be validated.
All Known Implementing Classes:
CarCriterionValidator, CarsValidator, CarValidator
public interface Validator<T>
An interface defining a method for validating objects of type T.

Implementations of this interface should provide validation logic for a specific type of object. If validation errors are detected, the validate(Object) method should return a list of error messages.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    List<String>
    validate(T t)
    Validates the given object of type T.
    static <T> void
    validate(T t, Validator<T> validator)
    A static helper method for validating an object and throwing an exception if validation errors occur.

  • Method Details

    • validate

      List<String> validate(T t)
      Validates the given object of type T.

      Implementations of this method should contain the validation logic for the T object and return a list of error messages if any errors are found. If there are no errors, the list should be empty.

      Parameters:
      t - the object to be validated.
      Returns:
      a list of validation error messages. The list is empty if there are no errors.

    • validate

      static <T> void validate(T t, Validator<T> validator)
      A static helper method for validating an object and throwing an exception if validation errors occur.

      This method uses the provided Validator to validate an object of type T. If the validation method returns a list of errors, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown with the error messages joined together.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the object to be validated.
      Parameters:
      t - the object to be validated.
      validator - an instance of Validator used to validate the object.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the list of validation errors is not empty.
